pr_title: Let realms gracefully terminate the authN chain

timeline.author: ywangd

replies.bodyText: Nope. If you call userListener.onResponse(null) the IteratingActionListener goes through on to the next realm in the chain, which is exactly what AuthenticationResult.Status.TERMINATE should prevent.
replies.author: albertzaharovits

replies.bodyText: You are absolutely correct. Sorry I mis-read the logic.

timeline.bodyText: I don't think exceptionally and gracefully are accurate descriptions. In one case an exception was provided, and in another it wasn't but it doesn't follow that one is graceful and the other isn't.
timeline.author: tvernum

replies.bodyText:
One code path amounts to calling request.exceptionProcessingRequest while the other calls request.authenticationFailed, albeit not in the same place where the gracefully/exceptionally terminology is being used.
One is more abrupt than the other.
I'm open to any suggestion wrt to terminology. For now I've removed both these keywords from the log lines.
replies.author: albertzaharovits

timeline.bodyText: It seems weird to have an onFailure with a possibly null exception. I get that it's handled correctly below, but can't it be handled here and be more idiomatic?
